page.title: 07GENERAL QUARRYING,TREVERVA
page.content: Although many of the quarries are disused there are still two working quarries in the area. Granite is quarried and is taken in lorries from the blasting site to the processing quarry.There the granite is cut into 40mm slabs by a machine,that is computer programmed.The blades of the cutter are made of diamonds and these need to be retipped every 3 to 4 weeks.This costs Â£4,000. After being cut the granite is polished on its face side.Any pieces of granite with faults are sold cheaply for garden patios and driveways.Any waste is put on a tip.The disused quarries can be an eyesore on the landscape.
